content:
Yes, there have been some non-UK citizens who have been appointed as life peers in the UK. Here are some examples:

1. Baroness Boothroyd - she was born in Yorkshire, but her father was a Belgian soldier and her mother was a Polish-Jewish refugee. She served as the Speaker of the House of Commons from 1992 to 2000 and was appointed to the House of Lords in 2000.

2. Baroness Hayman - she was born in Canada and was the first elected Speaker of the House of Commons. After stepping down from that role in 2000, she was appointed to the House of Lords.

3. Lord Patten of Barnes - he was born in Sudan and served as the last British Governor of Hong Kong. He was appointed as a life peer in 2005.

4. Baroness Manningham-Buller - she was born in Northamptonshire and served as the Director General of MI5 from 2002 to 2007. She was appointed to the House of Lords in 2008.

These are just a few examples, but there have been others over the years.
